body:
lmao

first, you were using alts to bypass the 10-guild limit (which was there for a reason), essentially breaking ruqqus (cap's words, not mine)

second, anyone can say the n-word around here. it all started off with [carp's post](/post/56sf) in deux, which you got mad at, therefore removing carp from the modlist via your alt and kicking the post. what gave you away was the [reply](https://cdn.discordapp.com/attachments/740747100475621439/781290056567619654/image0.png) from fifthfiend which got then replaced by basically [the same reply](/post/56sf/-/hymb) by klenvastergan, which triggered the alt check & subsequent ban

body:
Why didn't they make it impossible to do, which would have been technically trivial?

Why haven't they banned anyone else for doing it, or even bothered to check if anyone else is doing it, which would be technically trivial?

Why is there no rule against it?

body: I know this is in the wrong guild but there's starting to be quite a few complaints since I've been here about peoples free speech being taken away. Everytime I look there seems to be more people/guilds being banned over sudden new rules or unwritten rules that seem to only come into play for people that don't fit the current agenda of ruqqus or for people that are very disliked. Don't shit on me for this its just the truth

body:
>(cap's words, not mine)

Would you agree with any ban whatsoever if the admins say that the user broke the rules, even when the rules\* are as unclear as can be? 

\*I mean the ones stated in the TOS and Content Policy, because no one's going to look at every single comment on the site to see if some action is rule-breaking.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>
body_html:
(cap's words, not mine)

Would you agree with any ban whatsoever if the admins say that the user broke the rules, even when the rules* are as unclear as can be?

*I mean the ones stated in the TOS and Content Policy, because no one's going to look at every single comment on the site to see if some action is rule-breaking.

- sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, don't censor my username]

body:
Lol, Ruqqies, if you like hidden rules so much, then why do you hate reddit? It sounds like the perfect site for you!

There, you can go gloat about how "obvious" it is that posting about powermods is harassment, and how "obvious" it is that making subreddits about "election fraud" is impersonation!

>Why do you think they don't let single accounts have more then 10 guilds

I don't know, maybe they thought it would be too hard to manage that many guilds with a single account? I know that's not the reason, but the point is that rules should be clearly laid out. We shouldn't need to guess what they are. We shouldn't need to rely on "obvious" reasoning that may not be obvious to everyone.

<sup> - sfrohne [If you're going to post a screenshot of this comment, **don't** censor my username]</sup>

I don't know, maybe they thought it would be too hard to manage that many guilds with a single account? I know that's not the reason, but the point is that rules should be clearly laid out. We shouldn't need to guess what they are. We shouldn't need to rely on "obvious" reasoning that may not be obvious to everyone.
